00067 /*
00068  * not static, since snmpUDPIPv6Domain needs it, but not public, either.
00069  * (ie don't put it in a public header.)
00070  */
00071 void _netsnmp_udp_sockopt_set(int fd, int server);
00072 
00073 /*
00074  * Return a string representing the address in data, or else the "far end"
00075  * address if data is NULL.  
00076  */
00077 
00078 static char *
00079 netsnmp_udp_fmtaddr(netsnmp_transport *t, void *data, int len)
00080 {
00081     struct sockaddr_in *to = NULL;
00082 
00083     if (data != NULL && len == sizeof(struct sockaddr_in)) {
00084         to = (struct sockaddr_in *) data;
00085     } else if (t != NULL && t->data != NULL) {
00086         to = (struct sockaddr_in *) t->data;
00087     }
00088     if (to == NULL) {
00089         return strdup("UDP: unknown");
00090     } else {
00091         char tmp[64];
00092 
00093         sprintf(tmp, "UDP: [%s]:%hu",
00094                 inet_ntoa(to->sin_addr), ntohs(to->sin_port));
00095         return strdup(tmp);
00096     }
00097 }

00100 
00101 /*
00102  * You can write something into opaque that will subsequently get passed back 
00103  * to your send function if you like.  For instance, you might want to
00104  * remember where a PDU came from, so that you can send a reply there...  
00105  */
00106 
00107 static int
00108 netsnmp_udp_recv(netsnmp_transport *t, void *buf, int size,
00109                  void **opaque, int *olength)
00110 {
00111     int             rc = -1;
00112     socklen_t       fromlen = sizeof(struct sockaddr);
00113     struct sockaddr *from;
00114 
00115     if (t != NULL && t->sock >= 0) {
00116         from = (struct sockaddr *) malloc(sizeof(struct sockaddr_in));
00117         if (from == NULL) {
00118             *opaque = NULL;
00119             *olength = 0;
00120             return -1;
00121         } else {
00122             memset(from, 0, fromlen);
00123         }
00124 
00125         while (rc < 0) {
00126             rc = recvfrom(t->sock, buf, size, 0, from, &fromlen);
00127             if (rc < 0 && errno != EINTR) {
00128                 break;
00129             }
00130         }
00131 
00132         if (rc >= 0) {
00133             char *str = netsnmp_udp_fmtaddr(NULL, from, fromlen);
00134             DEBUGMSGTL(("netsnmp_udp",
00135                         "recvfrom fd %d got %d bytes (from %s)\n",
00136                         t->sock, rc, str));
00137             free(str);
00138         } else {
00139             DEBUGMSGTL(("netsnmp_udp", "recvfrom fd %d err %d (\"%s\")\n",
00140                         t->sock, errno, strerror(errno)));
00141         }
00142         *opaque = (void *)from;
00143         *olength = sizeof(struct sockaddr_in);
00144     }
00145     return rc;
00146 }
00147 
00148 
00149 
00150 static int
00151 netsnmp_udp_send(netsnmp_transport *t, void *buf, int size,
00152                  void **opaque, int *olength)
00153 {
00154     int rc = -1;
00155     struct sockaddr *to = NULL;
00156 
00157     if (opaque != NULL && *opaque != NULL &&
00158         *olength == sizeof(struct sockaddr_in)) {
00159         to = (struct sockaddr *) (*opaque);
00160     } else if (t != NULL && t->data != NULL &&
00161                t->data_length == sizeof(struct sockaddr_in)) {
00162         to = (struct sockaddr *) (t->data);
00163     }
00164 
00165     if (to != NULL && t != NULL && t->sock >= 0) {
00166         char *str = netsnmp_udp_fmtaddr(NULL, (void *) to,
00167                                         sizeof(struct sockaddr_in));
00168         DEBUGMSGTL(("netsnmp_udp", "send %d bytes from %p to %s on fd %d\n",
00169                     size, buf, str, t->sock));
00170         free(str);
00171         while (rc < 0) {
00172             rc = sendto(t->sock, buf, size, 0, to, sizeof(struct sockaddr));
00173             if (rc < 0 && errno != EINTR) {
00174                 DEBUGMSGTL(("netsnmp_udp", "sendto error, rc %d (errno %d)\n",
00175                             rc, errno));
00176                 break;
00177             }
00178         }
00179     }
00180     return rc;
00181 }
00182 
00183 
00184 
00185 static int
00186 netsnmp_udp_close(netsnmp_transport *t)
00187 {
00188     int rc = -1;
00189     if (t->sock >= 0) {
00190 #ifndef HAVE_CLOSESOCKET
00191         rc = close(t->sock);
00192 #else
00193         rc = closesocket(t->sock);
00194 #endif
00195         t->sock = -1;
00196     }
00197     return rc;
00198 }
00199 
00200 /*
00201  * find largest possible buffer between current size and specified size.
00202  *
00203  * Try to maximize the current buffer of type "optname"
00204  * to the maximum allowable size by the OS (as close to
00205  * size as possible)
00206  */
00207 static int
00208 _sock_buffer_maximize(int s, int optname, const char *buftype, int size)
00209 {
00210     int            curbuf = 0, curbuflen = sizeof(int);
00211     int            lo, mid, hi;
00212 
00213     /*
00214      * First we need to determine our current buffer
00215      */
00216     if ((getsockopt(s, SOL_SOCKET, optname, (void *) &curbuf,
00217                     &curbuflen) == 0) 
00218             && (curbuflen == sizeof(int))) {
00219 
00220         DEBUGMSGTL(("verbose:socket:buffer:max", "Current %s is %d\n",
00221                     buftype, curbuf));
00222 
00223         /*
00224          * Let's not be stupid ... if we were asked for less than what we
00225          * already have, then forget about it
00226          */
00227         if (size <= curbuf) {
00228             DEBUGMSGTL(("verbose:socket:buffer:max",
00229                         "Requested %s <= current buffer\n", buftype));
00230             return curbuf;
00231         }
00232 
00233         /*
00234          * Do a binary search the optimal buffer within 1k of the point of
00235          * failure. This is rather bruteforce, but simple
00236          */
00237         hi = size;
00238         lo = curbuf;
00239 
00240         while (hi - lo > 1024) {
00241             mid = (lo + hi) / 2;
00242             if (setsockopt(s, SOL_SOCKET, optname, (void *) &mid,
00243                         sizeof(int)) == 0) {
00244                 lo = mid; /* Success: search between mid and hi */
00245             } else {
00246                 hi = mid; /* Failed: search between lo and mid */
00247             }
00248         }
00249 
00250         /*
00251          * Now print if this optimization helped or not
00252          */
00253         if (getsockopt(s,SOL_SOCKET, optname, (void *) &curbuf,
00254                     &curbuflen) == 0) {
00255             DEBUGMSGTL(("socket:buffer:max", 
00256                         "Maximized %s: %d\n",buftype, curbuf));
00257         } 
00258     } else {
00259         /*
00260          * There is really not a lot we can do anymore.
00261          * If the OS doesn't give us the current buffer, then what's the 
00262          * point in trying to make it better
00263          */
00264         DEBUGMSGTL(("socket:buffer:max", "Get %s failed ... giving up!\n",
00265                     buftype));
00266         curbuf = -1;
00267     }
00268 
00269     return curbuf;
00270 }
00271 
00272 
00273 static const char *
00274 _sock_buf_type_get(int optname, int local)
00275 {
00276     if (optname == SO_SNDBUF) {
00277         if (local)
00278             return "server send buffer";
00279         else
00280             return "client send buffer";
00281     } else if (optname == SO_RCVBUF) {
00282         if (local)
00283             return "server receive buffer";
00284         else
00285             return "client receive buffer";
00286     }
00287 
00288     return "unknown buffer";
00289 }
00290 
00291 /*
00292  *
00293  * Get the requested buffersize, based on
00294  * - sockettype : client (local = 0) or server (local = 1) 
00295  * - buffertype : send (optname = SO_SNDBUF) or recv (SO_RCVBUF)
00296  *
00297  * In case a compile time buffer was specified, then use that one
00298  * if there was no runtime configuration override
00299  */
00300 static int
00301 _sock_buffer_size_get(int optname, int local, const char **buftype)
00302 {
00303     int size;
00304 
00305     if (NULL != buftype)
00306         *buftype = _sock_buf_type_get(optname, local);
00307 
00308     if (optname == SO_SNDBUF) {
00309         if (local) {
00310             size = netsnmp_ds_get_int(NETSNMP_DS_LIBRARY_ID, 
00311                     NETSNMP_DS_LIB_SERVERSENDBUF);
00312 #ifdef DEFAULT_SERVER_SEND_BUF
00313             if (size <= 0)
00314                size = DEFAULT_SERVER_SEND_BUF;
00315 #endif
00316         } else {
00317             size = netsnmp_ds_get_int(NETSNMP_DS_LIBRARY_ID, 
00318                     NETSNMP_DS_LIB_CLIENTSENDBUF);
00319 #ifdef DEFAULT_CLIENT_SEND_BUF
00320             if (size <= 0)
00321                size = DEFAULT_CLIENT_SEND_BUF;
00322 #endif
00323         }
00324     } else if (optname == SO_RCVBUF) {
00325         if (local) {
00326             size = netsnmp_ds_get_int(NETSNMP_DS_LIBRARY_ID, 
00327                     NETSNMP_DS_LIB_SERVERRECVBUF);
00328 #ifdef DEFAULT_SERVER_RECV_BUF
00329             if (size <= 0)
00330                size = DEFAULT_SERVER_RECV_BUF;
00331 #endif
00332         } else {
00333             size = netsnmp_ds_get_int(NETSNMP_DS_LIBRARY_ID, 
00334                     NETSNMP_DS_LIB_CLIENTRECVBUF);
00335 #ifdef DEFAULT_CLIENT_RECV_BUF
00336             if (size <= 0)
00337                size = DEFAULT_CLIENT_RECV_BUF;
00338 #endif
00339         }
00340     } else {
00341         size = 0;
00342     }
00343 
00344     DEBUGMSGTL(("socket:buffer", "Requested %s is %d\n",
00345                 (buftype) ? *buftype : "unknown buffer", size));
00346 
00347     return(size);
00348 }
00349 
00350 /*
00351  * set socket buffer size
00352  *
00353  * @param ss     : socket
00354  * @param optname: SO_SNDBUF or SO_RCVBUF
00355  * @param local  : 1 for server, 0 for client
00356  * @param reqbuf : requested size, or 0 for default
00357  *
00358  * @retval    -1 : error
00359  * @retval    >0 : new buffer size
00360  */
00361 int
00362 netsnmp_sock_buffer_set(int s, int optname, int local, int size)
00363 {
00364 #if ! defined(SO_SNDBUF) && ! defined(SO_RCVBUF)
00365     DEBUGMSGTL(("socket:buffer", "Changing socket buffer is not supported\n"));
00366     return -1;
00367 #else
00368     const char     *buftype;
00369     int            curbuf = 0, curbuflen = sizeof(int);
00370 
00371 #   ifndef  SO_SNDBUF
00372     if (SO_SNDBUF == optname) {
00373         DEBUGMSGTL(("socket:buffer",
00374                     "Changing socket send buffer is not supported\n"));
00375         return -1;
00376     }
00377 #   endif                          /*SO_SNDBUF */
00378 #   ifndef  SO_RCVBUF
00379     if (SO_RCVBUF == optname) {
00380         DEBUGMSGTL(("socket:buffer",
00381                     "Changing socket receive buffer is not supported\n"));
00382         return -1;
00383     }
00384 #   endif                          /*SO_RCVBUF */
00385 
00386     /*
00387      * What is the requested buffer size ?
00388      */
00389     if (0 == size)
00390         size = _sock_buffer_size_get(optname, local, &buftype);
00391     else {
00392         buftype = _sock_buf_type_get(optname, local);
00393         DEBUGMSGT(("verbose:socket:buffer", "Requested %s is %d\n",
00394                    buftype, size));
00395     }
00396 
00397     if ((getsockopt(s, SOL_SOCKET, optname, (void *) &curbuf,
00398                     &curbuflen) == 0) 
00399         && (curbuflen == sizeof(int))) {
00400         
00401         DEBUGMSGT(("verbose:socket:buffer", "Original %s is %d\n",
00402                    buftype, curbuf));
00403         if (curbuf >= size) {
00404             DEBUGMSGT(("verbose:socket:buffer",
00405                       "New %s size is smaller than original!\n", buftype));
00406         }
00407     }
00408 
00409     /*
00410      * If the buffersize was not specified or it was a negative value
00411      * then don't change the OS buffers at all
00412      */
00413     if (size <= 0) {
00414        DEBUGMSGT(("socket:buffer",
00415                     "%s not valid or not specified; using OS default(%d)\n",
00416                     buftype,curbuf));
00417        return curbuf;
00418     }
00419 
00420     /*
00421      * Try to set the requested send buffer
00422      */
00423     if (setsockopt(s, SOL_SOCKET, optname, (void *) &size, sizeof(int)) == 0) {
00424         /*
00425          * Because some platforms lie about the actual buffer that has been 
00426          * set (Linux will always say it worked ...), we print some 
00427          * diagnostic output for debugging
00428          */
00429         DEBUGIF("socket:buffer") {
00430             DEBUGMSGT(("socket:buffer", "Set %s to %d\n",
00431                        buftype, size));
00432             if ((getsockopt(s, SOL_SOCKET, optname, (void *) &curbuf,
00433                             &curbuflen) == 0) 
00434                     && (curbuflen == sizeof(int))) {
00435 
00436                 DEBUGMSGT(("verbose:socket:buffer",
00437                            "Now %s is %d\n", buftype, curbuf));
00438             }
00439         }
00440         /*
00441          * If the new buffer is smaller than the size we requested, we will
00442          * try to increment the new buffer with 1k increments 
00443          * (this will sometime allow us to reach a more optimal buffer.)
00444          *   For example : On Solaris, if the max OS buffer is 100k and you
00445          *   request 110k, you end up with the default 8k :-(
00446          */
00447         if (curbuf < size) {
00448             curbuf = _sock_buffer_maximize(s, optname, buftype, size);
00449             if(-1 != curbuf)
00450                 size = curbuf;
00451         }
00452 
00453     } else {
00454         /*
00455          * Obviously changing the buffer failed, most like like because we 
00456          * requested a buffer greater than the OS limit.
00457          * Therefore we need to search for an optimal buffer that is close
00458          * enough to the point of failure.
00459          * This will allow us to reach a more optimal buffer.
00460          *   For example : On Solaris, if the max OS buffer is 100k and you 
00461          *   request 110k, you end up with the default 8k :-(
00462          *   After this quick seach we would get 1k close to 100k (the max)
00463          */
00464         DEBUGMSGTL(("socket:buffer", "couldn't set %s to %d\n",
00465                     buftype, size));
00466 
00467         curbuf = _sock_buffer_maximize(s, optname, buftype, size);
00468         if(-1 != curbuf)
00469             size = curbuf;
00470     }
00471 
00472     return size;
00473 #endif
00474 }
00475 
00476 /*
00477  * Open a UDP-based transport for SNMP.  Local is TRUE if addr is the local
00478  * address to bind to (i.e. this is a server-type session); otherwise addr is 
00479  * the remote address to send things to.  
00480  */
00481 
00482 netsnmp_transport *
00483 netsnmp_udp_transport(struct sockaddr_in *addr, int local)
00484 {
00485     netsnmp_transport *t = NULL;
00486     int             rc = 0;
00487     char           *str = NULL;
00488     char           *client_socket = NULL;
00489 
00490     if (addr == NULL || addr->sin_family != AF_INET) {
00491         return NULL;
00492     }
00493 
00494     t = (netsnmp_transport *) malloc(sizeof(netsnmp_transport));
00495     if (t == NULL) {
00496         return NULL;
00497     }
00498 
00499     str = netsnmp_udp_fmtaddr(NULL, (void *)addr, 
00500                                  sizeof(struct sockaddr_in));
00501     DEBUGMSGTL(("netsnmp_udp", "open %s %s:%d\n", local ? "local" : "remote",
00502                 str,addr->sin_port));
00503     free(str);
00504 
00505     memset(t, 0, sizeof(netsnmp_transport));
00506 
00507     t->domain = netsnmpUDPDomain;
00508     t->domain_length = netsnmpUDPDomain_len;
00509 
00510     t->sock = socket(PF_INET, SOCK_DGRAM, 0);
00511     if (t->sock < 0) {
00512         netsnmp_transport_free(t);
00513         return NULL;
00514     }
00515 
00516     _netsnmp_udp_sockopt_set(t->sock, local);
00517 
00518     if (local) {
00519         /*
00520          * This session is inteneded as a server, so we must bind on to the
00521          * given IP address, which may include an interface address, or could
00522          * be INADDR_ANY, but certainly includes a port number.
00523          */
00524 
00525         t->local = malloc(6);
00526         if (t->local == NULL) {
00527             netsnmp_transport_free(t);
00528             return NULL;
00529         }
00530         memcpy(t->local, (u_char *) & (addr->sin_addr.s_addr), 4);
00531         t->local[4] = (htons(addr->sin_port) & 0xff00) >> 8;
00532         t->local[5] = (htons(addr->sin_port) & 0x00ff) >> 0;
00533         t->local_length = 6;
00534 
00535         rc = bind(t->sock, (struct sockaddr *) addr,
00536                   sizeof(struct sockaddr));
00537         if (rc != 0) {
00538             netsnmp_udp_close(t);
00539             netsnmp_transport_free(t);
00540             return NULL;
00541         }
00542         t->data = NULL;
00543         t->data_length = 0;
00544     } else {
00545         /*
00546          * This is a client session.  If we've been given a
00547          * client address to send from, then bind to that.
00548          * Otherwise the send will use "something sensible".
00549          */
00550         client_socket = netsnmp_ds_get_string(NETSNMP_DS_LIBRARY_ID,
00551                                               NETSNMP_DS_LIB_CLIENT_ADDR);
00552         if (client_socket) {
00553             struct sockaddr_in client_addr;
00554             netsnmp_sockaddr_in( &client_addr, client_socket, 0);
00555             client_addr.sin_port = 0;
00556             bind(t->sock, (struct sockaddr *)&client_addr,
00557                   sizeof(struct sockaddr));
00558         }
00559         /*
00560          * Save the (remote) address in the
00561          * transport-specific data pointer for later use by netsnmp_udp_send.
00562          */
00563 
00564         t->data = malloc(sizeof(struct sockaddr_in));
00565         t->remote = malloc(6);
00566         if (t->data == NULL || t->remote == NULL) {
00567             netsnmp_transport_free(t);
00568             return NULL;
00569         }
00570         memcpy(t->remote, (u_char *) & (addr->sin_addr.s_addr), 4);
00571         t->remote[4] = (htons(addr->sin_port) & 0xff00) >> 8;
00572         t->remote[5] = (htons(addr->sin_port) & 0x00ff) >> 0;
00573         t->remote_length = 6;
00574         memcpy(t->data, addr, sizeof(struct sockaddr_in));
00575         t->data_length = sizeof(struct sockaddr_in);
00576     }
00577 
00578     /*
00579      * 16-bit length field, 8 byte UDP header, 20 byte IPv4 header  
00580      */
00581 
00582     t->msgMaxSize = 0xffff - 8 - 20;
00583     t->f_recv     = netsnmp_udp_recv;
00584     t->f_send     = netsnmp_udp_send;
00585     t->f_close    = netsnmp_udp_close;
00586     t->f_accept   = NULL;
00587     t->f_fmtaddr  = netsnmp_udp_fmtaddr;
00588 
00589     return t;
00590 }
00591 
00592 
00593 void
00594 _netsnmp_udp_sockopt_set(int fd, int local)
00595 {
00596 #ifdef  SO_BSDCOMPAT
00597     /*
00598      * Patch for Linux.  Without this, UDP packets that fail get an ICMP
00599      * response.  Linux turns the failed ICMP response into an error message
00600      * and return value, unlike all other OS's.  
00601      */
00602     if (0 == netsnmp_os_prematch("Linux","2.4"))
00603     {
00604         int             one = 1;
00605         DEBUGMSGTL(("socket:option", "setting socket option SO_BSDCOMPAT\n"));
00606         setsockopt(fd, SOL_SOCKET, SO_BSDCOMPAT, (void *) &one,
00607                    sizeof(one));
00608     }
00609 #endif                          /*SO_BSDCOMPAT */
00610     /*
00611      * SO_REUSEADDR will allow multiple apps to open the same port at
00612      * the same time. Only the last one to open the socket will get
00613      * data. Obviously, for an agent, this is a bad thing. There should
00614      * only be one listener.
00615      */
00616 #ifdef ALLOW_PORT_HIJACKING
00617 #ifdef  SO_REUSEADDR
00618     /*
00619      * Allow the same port to be specified multiple times without failing.
00620      *    (useful for a listener)
00621      */
00622     {
00623         int             one = 1;
00624         DEBUGMSGTL(("socket:option", "setting socket option SO_REUSEADDR\n"));
00625         setsockopt(fd, SOL_SOCKET, SO_REUSEADDR, (void *) &one,
00626                    sizeof(one));
00627     }
00628 #endif                          /*SO_REUSEADDR */
00629 #endif
00630 
00631     /*
00632      * Try to set the send and receive buffers to a reasonably large value, so
00633      * that we can send and receive big PDUs (defaults to 8192 bytes (!) on
00634      * Solaris, for instance).  Don't worry too much about errors -- just
00635      * plough on regardless.  
00636      */
00637     netsnmp_sock_buffer_set(fd, SO_SNDBUF, local, 0);
00638     netsnmp_sock_buffer_set(fd, SO_RCVBUF, local, 0);
00639 }
00640 
00641 int
00642 netsnmp_sockaddr_in(struct sockaddr_in *addr,
00643                     const char *inpeername, int remote_port)
00644 {
00645     char           *cp = NULL, *peername = NULL;
00646 
00647     if (addr == NULL) {
00648         return 0;
00649     }
00650     memset(addr, 0, sizeof(struct sockaddr_in));
00651 
00652     DEBUGMSGTL(("netsnmp_sockaddr_in", "addr %p, peername \"%s\"\n",
00653                 addr, inpeername ? inpeername : "[NIL]"));
00654 
00655     addr->sin_addr.s_addr = htonl(INADDR_ANY);
00656     addr->sin_family = AF_INET;
00657     if (remote_port > 0) {
00658         addr->sin_port = htons((u_short)remote_port);
00659     } else if (netsnmp_ds_get_int(NETSNMP_DS_LIBRARY_ID, 
00660                                   NETSNMP_DS_LIB_DEFAULT_PORT) > 0) {
00661         addr->sin_port = htons((u_short)netsnmp_ds_get_int(NETSNMP_DS_LIBRARY_ID, 
00662                                                  NETSNMP_DS_LIB_DEFAULT_PORT));
00663     } else {
00664         addr->sin_port = htons(SNMP_PORT);
00665     }
00666 
00667     if (inpeername != NULL) {
00668         /*
00669          * Duplicate the peername because we might want to mank around with
00670          * it.  
00671          */
00672 
00673         peername = strdup(inpeername);
00674         if (peername == NULL) {
00675             return 0;
00676         }
00677 
00678         /*
00679          * Try and extract an appended port number.  
00680          */
00681         cp = strchr(peername, ':');
00682         if (cp != NULL) {
00683             *cp = '\0';
00684             cp++;
00685             if (atoi(cp) != 0) {
00686                 DEBUGMSGTL(("netsnmp_sockaddr_in",
00687                             "port number suffix :%d\n", atoi(cp)));
00688                 addr->sin_port = htons((u_short)atoi(cp));
00689             }
00690         }
00691 
00692         for (cp = peername; *cp && isdigit((int) *cp); cp++);
00693         if (!*cp && atoi(peername) != 0) {
00694             /*
00695              * Okay, it looks like just a port number.  
00696              */
00697             DEBUGMSGTL(("netsnmp_sockaddr_in", "totally numeric: %d\n",
00698                         atoi(peername)));
00699             addr->sin_port = htons((u_short)atoi(peername));
00700         } else if (inet_addr(peername) != INADDR_NONE) {
00701             /*
00702              * It looks like an IP address.  
00703              */
00704             DEBUGMSGTL(("netsnmp_sockaddr_in", "IP address\n"));
00705             addr->sin_addr.s_addr = inet_addr(peername);
00706         } else {
00707             /*
00708              * Well, it must be a hostname then.  
00709              */
00710 #ifdef  HAVE_GETHOSTBYNAME
00711             struct hostent *hp = gethostbyname(peername);
00712             if (hp == NULL) {
00713                 DEBUGMSGTL(("netsnmp_sockaddr_in",
00714                             "hostname (couldn't resolve)\n"));
00715                 free(peername);
00716                 return 0;
00717             } else {
00718                 if (hp->h_addrtype != AF_INET) {
00719                     DEBUGMSGTL(("netsnmp_sockaddr_in",
00720                                 "hostname (not AF_INET!)\n"));
00721                     free(peername);
00722                     return 0;
00723                 } else {
00724                     DEBUGMSGTL(("netsnmp_sockaddr_in",
00725                                 "hostname (resolved okay)\n"));
00726                     memcpy(&(addr->sin_addr), hp->h_addr, hp->h_length);
00727                 }
00728             }
00729 #else                           /*HAVE_GETHOSTBYNAME */
00730             DEBUGMSGTL(("netsnmp_sockaddr_in",
00731                         "hostname (no gethostbyname)\n"));
00732             free(peername);
00733             return 0;
00734 #endif                          /*HAVE_GETHOSTBYNAME */
00735         }
00736     } else {
00737         DEBUGMSGTL(("netsnmp_sockaddr_in", "NULL peername"));
00738         return 0;
00739     }
00740     DEBUGMSGTL(("netsnmp_sockaddr_in", "return { AF_INET, %s:%hu }\n",
00741                 inet_ntoa(addr->sin_addr), ntohs(addr->sin_port)));
00742     free(peername);
00743     return 1;
00744 }
00745 
00746 
00747 
00748 #if !defined(DISABLE_SNMPV1) || !defined(DISABLE_SNMPV2C)
00749 /*
00750  * The following functions provide the "com2sec" configuration token
00751  * functionality for compatibility.  
00752  */
00753 
00754 #define EXAMPLE_NETWORK         "NETWORK"
00755 #define EXAMPLE_COMMUNITY       "COMMUNITY"
00756 
00757 typedef struct _com2SecEntry {
00758     char            community[VACMSTRINGLEN];
00759     unsigned long   network;
00760     unsigned long   mask;
00761     char            secName[VACMSTRINGLEN];
00762     char            contextName[VACMSTRINGLEN];
00763     struct _com2SecEntry *next;
00764 } com2SecEntry;
00765 
00766 com2SecEntry   *com2SecList = NULL, *com2SecListLast = NULL;
00767 
00768 void
00769 netsnmp_udp_parse_security(const char *token, char *param)
00770 {
00771     char            secName[VACMSTRINGLEN];
00772     char            contextName[VACMSTRINGLEN];
00773     char            community[VACMSTRINGLEN];
00774     char            source[SNMP_MAXBUF_SMALL];
00775     char           *cp = NULL;
00776     const char     *strmask = NULL;
00777     com2SecEntry   *e = NULL;
00778     in_addr_t   network = 0, mask = 0;
00779 
00780     /*
00781      * Get security, source address/netmask and community strings.  
00782      */
00783 
00784     cp = copy_nword( param, secName, sizeof(secName));
00785     if (strcmp(secName, "-Cn") == 0) {
00786         if (!cp) {
00787             config_perror("missing CONTEXT_NAME parameter");
00788             return;
00789         }
00790         cp = copy_nword( cp, contextName, sizeof(contextName));
00791         cp = copy_nword( cp, secName, sizeof(secName));
00792     } else {
00793         contextName[0] = '\0';
00794     }
00795     if (secName[0] == '\0') {
00796         config_perror("missing NAME parameter");
00797         return;
00798     } else if (strlen(secName) > (VACMSTRINGLEN - 1)) {
00799         config_perror("security name too long");
00800         return;
00801     }
00802     cp = copy_nword( cp, source, sizeof(source));
00803     if (source[0] == '\0') {
00804         config_perror("missing SOURCE parameter");
00805         return;
00806     } else if (strncmp(source, EXAMPLE_NETWORK, strlen(EXAMPLE_NETWORK)) ==
00807                0) {
00808         config_perror("example config NETWORK not properly configured");
00809         return;
00810     }
00811     cp = copy_nword( cp, community, sizeof(community));
00812     if (community[0] == '\0') {
00813         config_perror("missing COMMUNITY parameter\n");
00814         return;
00815     } else
00816         if (strncmp
00817             (community, EXAMPLE_COMMUNITY, strlen(EXAMPLE_COMMUNITY))
00818             == 0) {
00819         config_perror("example config COMMUNITY not properly configured");
00820         return;
00821     } else if (strlen(community) > (VACMSTRINGLEN - 1)) {
00822         config_perror("community name too long");
00823         return;
00824     }
00825 
00826     /*
00827      * Process the source address/netmask string.  
00828      */
00829 
00830     cp = strchr(source, '/');
00831     if (cp != NULL) {
00832         /*
00833          * Mask given.  
00834          */
00835         *cp = '\0';
00836         strmask = cp + 1;
00837     }
00838 
00839     /*
00840      * Deal with the network part first.  
00841      */
00842 
00843     if ((strcmp(source, "default") == 0)
00844         || (strcmp(source, "0.0.0.0") == 0)) {
00845         network = 0;
00846         strmask = "0.0.0.0";
00847     } else {
00848         /*
00849          * Try interpreting as a dotted quad.  
00850          */
00851         network = inet_addr(source);
00852 
00853         if (network == (in_addr_t) -1) {
00854             /*
00855              * Nope, wasn't a dotted quad.  Must be a hostname.  
00856              */
00857 #ifdef  HAVE_GETHOSTBYNAME
00858             struct hostent *hp = gethostbyname(source);
00859             if (hp == NULL) {
00860                 config_perror("bad source address");
00861                 return;
00862             } else {
00863                 if (hp->h_addrtype != AF_INET) {
00864                     config_perror("no IP address for source hostname");
00865                     return;
00866                 }
00867                 network = *((in_addr_t *) hp->h_addr);
00868             }
00869 #else                           /*HAVE_GETHOSTBYNAME */
00870             /*
00871              * Oh dear.  
00872              */
00873             config_perror("cannot resolve source hostname");
00874             return;
00875 #endif                          /*HAVE_GETHOSTBYNAME */
00876         }
00877     }
00878 
00879     /*
00880      * Now work out the mask.  
00881      */
00882 
00883     if (strmask == NULL || *strmask == '\0') {
00884         /*
00885          * No mask was given.  Use 255.255.255.255.  
00886          */
00887         mask = 0xffffffffL;
00888     } else {
00889         if (strchr(strmask, '.')) {
00890             /*
00891              * Try to interpret mask as a dotted quad.  
00892              */
00893             mask = inet_addr(strmask);
00894             if (mask == (in_addr_t) -1 &&
00895                 strncmp(strmask, "255.255.255.255", 15) != 0) {
00896                 config_perror("bad mask");
00897                 return;
00898             }
00899         } else {
00900             /*
00901              * Try to interpret mask as a "number of 1 bits".  
00902              */
00903             int             maskLen = atoi(strmask), maskBit = 0x80000000L;
00904             if (maskLen <= 0 || maskLen > 32) {
00905                 config_perror("bad mask length");
00906                 return;
00907             }
00908             while (maskLen--) {
00909                 mask |= maskBit;
00910                 maskBit >>= 1;
00911             }
00912             mask = htonl(mask);
00913         }
00914     }
00915 
00916     /*
00917      * Check that the network and mask are consistent.  
00918      */
00919 
00920     if (network & ~mask) {
00921         config_perror("source/mask mismatch");
00922         return;
00923     }
00924 
00925     e = (com2SecEntry *) malloc(sizeof(com2SecEntry));
00926     if (e == NULL) {
00927         config_perror("memory error");
00928         return;
00929     }
00930 
00931     /*
00932      * Everything is okay.  Copy the parameters to the structure allocated
00933      * above and add it to END of the list.  
00934      */
00935 
00936     DEBUGMSGTL(("netsnmp_udp_parse_security",
00937                 "<\"%s\", 0x%08x/0x%08x> => \"%s\"\n", community, network,
00938                 mask, secName));
00939 
00940     strcpy(e->contextName, contextName);
00941     strcpy(e->secName, secName);
00942     strcpy(e->community, community);
00943     e->network = network;
00944     e->mask = mask;
00945     e->next = NULL;
00946 
00947     if (com2SecListLast != NULL) {
00948         com2SecListLast->next = e;
00949         com2SecListLast = e;
00950     } else {
00951         com2SecListLast = com2SecList = e;
00952     }
00953 }
00954 
00955 
00956 void
00957 netsnmp_udp_com2SecList_free(void)
00958 {
00959     com2SecEntry   *e = com2SecList;
00960     while (e != NULL) {
00961         com2SecEntry   *tmp = e;
00962         e = e->next;
00963         free(tmp);
00964     }
00965     com2SecList = com2SecListLast = NULL;
00966 }
00967 #endif /* support for community based SNMP */
00968 
00969 void
00970 netsnmp_udp_agent_config_tokens_register(void)
00971 {
00972 #if !defined(DISABLE_SNMPV1) || !defined(DISABLE_SNMPV2C)
00973     register_app_config_handler("com2sec", netsnmp_udp_parse_security,
00974                                 netsnmp_udp_com2SecList_free,
00975                                 "[-Cn CONTEXT] secName IPv4-network-address[/netmask] community");
00976 #endif /* support for community based SNMP */
00977 }
00978 
00979 
00980 
00981 /*
00982  * Return 0 if there are no com2sec entries, or return 1 if there ARE com2sec 
00983  * entries.  On return, if a com2sec entry matched the passed parameters,
00984  * then *secName points at the appropriate security name, or is NULL if the
00985  * parameters did not match any com2sec entry.  
00986  */
00987 
00988 #if !defined(DISABLE_SNMPV1) || !defined(DISABLE_SNMPV2C)
00989 int
00990 netsnmp_udp_getSecName(void *opaque, int olength,
00991                        const char *community,
00992                        size_t community_len, char **secName,
00993                        char **contextName)
00994 {
00995     com2SecEntry   *c;
00996     struct sockaddr_in *from = (struct sockaddr_in *) opaque;
00997     char           *ztcommunity = NULL;
00998 
00999     if (secName != NULL) {
01000         *secName = NULL;  /* Haven't found anything yet */
01001     }
01002 
01003     /*
01004      * Special case if there are NO entries (as opposed to no MATCHING
01005      * entries).  
01006      */
01007 
01008     if (com2SecList == NULL) {
01009         DEBUGMSGTL(("netsnmp_udp_getSecName", "no com2sec entries\n"));
01010         return 0;
01011     }
01012 
01013     /*
01014      * If there is no IPv4 source address, then there can be no valid security
01015      * name.  
01016      */
01017 
01018     if (opaque == NULL || olength != sizeof(struct sockaddr_in) ||
01019         from->sin_family != AF_INET) {
01020         DEBUGMSGTL(("netsnmp_udp_getSecName",
01021                     "no IPv4 source address in PDU?\n"));
01022         return 1;
01023     }
01024 
01025     DEBUGIF("netsnmp_udp_getSecName") {
01026         ztcommunity = (char *)malloc(community_len + 1);
01027         if (ztcommunity != NULL) {
01028             memcpy(ztcommunity, community, community_len);
01029             ztcommunity[community_len] = '\0';
01030         }
01031 
01032         DEBUGMSGTL(("netsnmp_udp_getSecName", "resolve <\"%s\", 0x%08x>\n",
01033                     ztcommunity ? ztcommunity : "<malloc error>",
01034                     from->sin_addr.s_addr));
01035     }
01036 
01037     for (c = com2SecList; c != NULL; c = c->next) {
01038         DEBUGMSGTL(("netsnmp_udp_getSecName","compare <\"%s\", 0x%08x/0x%08x>",
01039                     c->community, c->network, c->mask));
01040         if ((community_len == strlen(c->community)) &&
01041             (memcmp(community, c->community, community_len) == 0) &&
01042             ((from->sin_addr.s_addr & c->mask) == c->network)) {
01043             DEBUGMSG(("netsnmp_udp_getSecName", "... SUCCESS\n"));
01044             if (secName != NULL) {
01045                 *secName = c->secName;
01046                 *contextName = c->contextName;
01047             }
01048             break;
01049         }
01050         DEBUGMSG(("netsnmp_udp_getSecName", "... nope\n"));
01051     }
01052     if (ztcommunity != NULL) {
01053         free(ztcommunity);
01054     }
01055     return 1;
01056 }
01057 #endif /* support for community based SNMP */
01058 
01059 
01060 netsnmp_transport *
01061 netsnmp_udp_create_tstring(const char *str, int local)
01062 {
01063     struct sockaddr_in addr;
01064 
01065     if (netsnmp_sockaddr_in(&addr, str, 0)) {
01066         return netsnmp_udp_transport(&addr, local);
01067     } else {
01068         return NULL;
01069     }
01070 }
01071 
01072 
01073 netsnmp_transport *
01074 netsnmp_udp_create_ostring(const u_char * o, size_t o_len, int local)
01075 {
01076     struct sockaddr_in addr;
01077 
01078     if (o_len == 6) {
01079         unsigned short porttmp = (o[4] << 8) + o[5];
01080         addr.sin_family = AF_INET;
01081         memcpy((u_char *) & (addr.sin_addr.s_addr), o, 4);
01082         addr.sin_port = htons(porttmp);
01083         return netsnmp_udp_transport(&addr, local);
01084     }
01085     return NULL;
01086 }
01087 
01088 
01089 void
01090 netsnmp_udp_ctor(void)
01091 {
01092     udpDomain.name = netsnmpUDPDomain;
01093     udpDomain.name_length = netsnmpUDPDomain_len;
01094     udpDomain.prefix = calloc(2, sizeof(char *));
01095     udpDomain.prefix[0] = "udp";
01096 
01097     udpDomain.f_create_from_tstring = netsnmp_udp_create_tstring;
01098     udpDomain.f_create_from_ostring = netsnmp_udp_create_ostring;
01099 
01100     netsnmp_tdomain_register(&udpDomain);
01101 }
